item.title: Adding netty networking to Project Insanity, proven to hold 2,000+ players
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:73, topic:440155”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=542836.msg3990555#msg3990555 date=1336521328]

[5/8/12 7:11 PM]: [Logging in]: Hi666
[5/8/12 7:11 PM]: returncode:5

And every time I press ‘log in’ it says in the command prompt, ‘returncode:5’ while telling me my account is already logged in. Does this have to do with PlayerHandler? Which class?

I think a thread is being blocked, kinda like a deadlock. I’m not really sure, but that has happened to me before with an unrelated deadlock.

How would I go about fixing it?
[/quote]

Undo this shit, lol.[/quote]

Its all backed up :p.

Read full topic

item.source: Adding netty networking to Project Insanity, proven to hold 2,000+ players

item.title: Adding netty networking to Project Insanity, proven to hold 2,000+ players
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

Did you remove the old five second time out from process?

Project Insanity has a time out system, if no packet is received (or data) in five seconds the player is disconnected.

Response code five is ‘Character already logged in’

You can find a list here.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding netty networking to Project Insanity, proven to hold 2,000+ players
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:66, topic:440155”][quote author=TheHolyGrail link=topic=542836.msg3988772#msg3988772 date=1336279627]
.classpath and .project are files created while using Eclipse. They have absolutely nothing to do with netty.
[/quote]

really? shit didn’t know… -.-

you might also want to add like a uid system for this if(uid == 0 || uid == Config.CLIENT_UID) { System.out.println("Client using wrong uid."); channel.close(); return false; }

^ wouldn’t use that, but it’s an [size=12pt]example.[/size][/quote]
UID wouldn’t really help at all…

Read full topic

item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

TheHolyGrail:

.classpath and .project are files created while using Eclipse. They have absolutely nothing to do with netty.

Did you not notice the “(not required)” ? It has to do with netty partially because some noobs just don’t know how to add the jar into the eclipse classpath at all.

item.title: Adding netty networking to Project Insanity, proven to hold 2,000+ players
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Mystic-Effect, post:56, topic:440155”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=542836.msg3987713#msg3987713 date=1336151565]

why go over 2000…

why not? i’d host the maximum amount of people on one server before updating took longer than 600 ms cuz i’m a cheap ass.

edit
@s_ you would need to create a custom serializer to make use of the akka remote actors in a rsps, correct?

I don’t think there would ever be over 2k players in one rsps…
[/quote]

near-reality has way more than 2k players.[/quote]
cause they have been around since the beginning
also your sig shows how r-s has some stupid members

what i’m trying to say is that; there is no real reason to reach more than 2k players because it will take over 2 years to reach that amount or be able to hold more than 2k players.

Read full topic
